soc.client
Class DisplaylessPlayerClient

java.lang.Object
  soc.client.DisplaylessPlayerClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
RobotClient
public class DisplaylessPlayerClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

GUI-less standalone client for connecting to the SOCServer. If you want another connection port, you have to specify it as the "port" argument in the html source. If you run this as a stand-alone, you have to specify the port.

The RobotClient is based on this client.

Author:
Robert S Thomas

Constructor Detail

DisplaylessPlayerClient

public DisplaylessPlayerClient()
Create a DisplaylessPlayerClient, which would connect to localhost port 8889. Does not actually connect; subclass must connect, such as RobotClient.init()

Note: The default OpenSettlers server port is 8880.

DisplaylessPlayerClient

public DisplaylessPlayerClient(java.lang.String h,
                               int p,
                               boolean visual)
Constructor for connecting to the specified host, on the specified port. Does not actually connect; subclass must connect, such as RobotClient.init()

Parameters:
h - host
p - port
visual - true if this client is visual

DisplaylessPlayerClient

public DisplaylessPlayerClient(java.lang.String s,
                               boolean visual)
Constructor for connecting to a local game (practice) on a local stringport. Does not actually connect; subclass must connect, such as RobotClient.init()

Parameters:
s - the stringport that the server listens on
visual - true if this client is visual

handlePLAYERELEMENT_numPieces

public static void handlePLAYERELEMENT_numPieces(PlayerElement mes,
                                                 Player pl,
                                                 int pieceType)
Update a player's amount of a playing piece, for handlePLAYERELEMENT(PlayerElement). To avoid code duplication, also called from PlayerClient.handlePLAYERELEMENT(PlayerElement) and RobotBrain.run().

Parameters:
mes - Message with amount and action (SET/GAIN/LOSE)
pl - Player to update
pieceType - Playing piece type, as in PlayingPiece.ROAD

handlePLAYERELEMENT_numKnights

public static void handlePLAYERELEMENT_numKnights(PlayerElement mes,
                                                  Player pl,
                                                  Game ga)
Update a player's amount of knights, and game's largest army, for handlePLAYERELEMENT(PlayerElement). To avoid code duplication, also called from PlayerClient.handlePLAYERELEMENT(PlayerElement) and RobotBrain.run().

Parameters:
mes - Message with amount and action (SET/GAIN/LOSE)
pl - Player to update
ga - Game of player

handlePLAYERELEMENT_numRsrc

public static void handlePLAYERELEMENT_numRsrc(PlayerElement mes,
                                               Player pl,
                                               int rtype)
Update a player's amount of a resource, for handlePLAYERELEMENT(PlayerElement).
  • If this is a PlayerElement.LOSE action, and the player does not have enough of that type, the rest are taken from the player's UNKNOWN amount.
  • If we are losing from type UNKNOWN, first convert player's known resources to unknown resources (individual amount information will be lost), then remove mes's unknown resources from player.

To avoid code duplication, also called from PlayerClient.handlePLAYERELEMENT(PlayerElement) and RobotBrain.run().

Parameters:
mes - Message with amount and action (SET/GAIN/LOSE)
pl - Player to update
rtype - Type of resource, like ResourceConstants.CLAY
